title: "What is the connection between dissociative observer, spirituality, and sexuality, according to Quantum Psychology principles?"
first_phrase: This text delves into the concept of the dissociative observer in Quantum Psychology. The author shares a story about a woman who labeled her dissociation as spiritual and became grandiose, promoting herself as a guru. The principles related to the dissociative observer are outlined, including how fear, trauma, and dissociation can lead to a loss of humanness and personal grandiosity. Additionally, the text discusses the role of observer-identities in fixing attention and bolstering personal survival. The last 200 tokens further explore these concepts and highlight the trance-like state that observer-identities can create during arguments.
content: QUANTUM PSYCHOLOGY PRINCIPLE: The more dissociative the observer becomes, the more there is a loss of the body and, consequently, a loss of humanness and connection to humanity. QUANTUM PSYCHOLOGY PRINCIPLE: The stronger the dissociative observer, the greater the personal grandiosity. In order to survive, an observer, as well as a personality with many identities is formed, such as, "I like this," "I don't like this," "I like you," "I don't like you." These particular observers and identities contain trance states with emotions, associations and memories. Each observer-identity has many trances and ways to fixate attention. For the observer who wishes to keep and defend the individual self, these trance states must be kept alive. Inherent in all of this is the understanding that if energy is not continually put into them by the observer and these identities, then they will die or disappear. When two people argue, it is an argument of two trance-positioned observer-identities. In this way, observer identities get more and more energy put into them because people imagine and, hence, feel their survival is dependent upon them. This is a survival trance.
last_phrase: In conclusion, our observer-identities play a crucial role in our survival, and as such, we must continually feed them with energy to keep them alive. However, when we become too dissociative and fixate on one particular identity, we lose touch with our humanness and our connection to humanity. We must strive to maintain a balanced approach to our observer-identities and avoid getting trapped in survival trances that limit our growth and potential. By understanding these principles of quantum psychology, we can develop multi-dimensional awareness and live more fulfilling and authentic lives.
